page.title: 19ST.PHILIP'S CHURCH
page.content:
The Church is just over 30 years old and the foundation stone was laid by the{Duke of Devonshire}in 1954. It has a bell tower. The bell is much older than the church and came from Derwent Village before it was flooded to make the Derwent Reservoir in north Derbyshire. The signatures of the {Queen and Prince Philip}are in the visitors' book following their visit.
The church holds three services every day as well as special services such as weddings, christenings and funerals. In 1984 there were 21 weddings and 16 christenings. There is a{Sunday School}which is attended by 20 children. The{Church Hall}is used by a playgroup, scouts, cubs, guides and brownies as well as the Evergreen Club (Pensioners) and Ladies' Club.
